intro: Josephia carduacea, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in dry environments. Josephia carduacea is adapted to thrive in poor soils and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
